rComments: She doesn't post lecture slides on the class webpage so attendance is mandatory. Lectures are very dense and you have to keep up with what she says or you're done for. The actual content of the course isn't too hard to understand but you'll need to know all of it for exams and assignments

Prof. Teichman is a good lecturer, but be prepared to write down everything she says or have no clue what is going on. She talks fast and everything is important. She doesn't post lecture slide and is TOTALLY unapproachable outside of class and during office hours, she doesn't answer any questions that she thinks she's already covered in class.

At least for the course that I took, lecture is defiantly not optional, tutorial is also pretty mandatory. Friendly but expects a lot from you. Not in a bad way, this is UofT. Word of advice: you don't actually have to read the readings, just know what they are about from front to back. (Finesse some shordy to get the info)
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: At least for the course that I took, lecture is defiantly not optional, tutorial is also pretty mandatory. Friendly but expects a lot from you. Not in a bad way, this is UofT.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: She doesn't post any lecture slides so you have to go to class and write down everything she says or you won't have a clue what this class is about. But ironically I find that I've learned the most from her than from any of my other more entertaining profs. She also tells you exactly how to write the term paper so it's not hard.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Respected', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Took this course after an interest in POLB90 and loved her teaching in POLB90. Read the reviews and decided to pursue POLC94 anyway, quite a mistake. Exams and essays are graded completely unfairly. I would personally advise steering away from this course if you can.

I enjoyed the course and the material and gave it a good course evaluation. However, I will echo the sentiments of the other comments here regarding unapproachability. Though the professor is a nice person. I had an extremely pleasant in her b90 class but this c level took a turn for the worse. This was disappointing.

By far the most organized prof I've had. She clearly goes through each point in lecture at a reasonable speed & her examples provide you with the best understanding & relations to course terms. She responds quickly to emails. Her TAs are innovative & approachable. Her exams are not the easiest but she provides a useful study guide which is fair.
Very good lecturer and well organized lectures. She's interesting and very clear. She's a bit unapproachable, but her TAs, especially Paul last year, were very good.

Very well organized and detailed. She could literally spend lots of time explaining things to you. (People taking this coursein WInter, 06: remember she spent 1 hour of lecture time explaining us how to write our term paper? Which other teacher does that?
she really knows her stuff ... though she is a bit intimidating at times

Teichman's expectations aren't very high. It's easy to do well in this class if you do your readings. Her lectures are organised and clear. My main problem with her is that she basically just repeats what the readings say and can get boring.. good thing she shows movies from time to time.
not the most approachable person, but she really knows her stuff.  very very good lecturer...good use of powerpoint and she doesn't go too fast.
she is tough and demanding, and it's a good thing UTSC's slacker students have to deal with her. i think she's excellent, clear and very knowledgable.

This woman needs to leave the University of Toronto. She is extremely arrogant and unapproachable not to mention rude. She loves to see things through one perspective - HER OWN. I have no idea how she became a professor, especially with tenure. People like her are a shame to academia.
